FacilityName: City of Hays Water Softening Plant

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
A). The City of Hays Water Softening Plant (WSP) accidental release prevention policy involves approach that integrates technologies, procedures, and management practices. All applicable procedures of the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Prevention Program are adhered to. The City of Hays Water Softening Plant emergency response program is for the operator on duty to assess the leak, evacuate all individuals from the faciity to a safe place, call emergency services (9911) to activate the first responder City of Hays Fire Department Hazardous Materials Team and Local Emergency Planning Coordination.

B). The Water Softening Plant Chlorination Station has been installed to disinfect the water flow into the City of Hays water distribution system. The chlorination system is located on the southeast corner of the main building at 1000 Vine Street, Hays, KS. The station includes a chlorination room, which contains liquid chlorine containers, a chlorinator, and various safety equipment, and an instrument room, which contains a flow recorder, various electrical panels, additional safety equipment and a digital atmosphere reading of chlorine in parts per million, that can be read outside the chlorine storage room and in the lab. The amount of chlorine handled is 4 one-ton containers and 20 one hundred fifty pound containers. The chlorine station is checked every two hours by plant operator in a 24 hour day seven days a week and will respond to any trouble alarms which may occur in a matter of minutes.

D). The general Water Sofenting Plant accident release prevention program is based on the following key elements: 
High level of training of the water plant staff .  
Preventive maintenance program.
Use of state-of the-art process and safety equipment. 
Use of accurate and effective operating procedures, written with the participation of water plant staff.
Performance of a  hazard review of equipment and procedures and an emergency evacuation plan that is in effect.

E).  This facility has an emergency evacuation plan. The emergency response plan which has been coordinated (reviewed) by the City of Hays Fire Department, which is a member of the Local Emergency Response Planning Committee (LEPC). This program includes an emergency response decision tree and a notification plan. Emergency response drills and drill evaluations. Emergency operation and response procedures are also reviewed periodically. 
Chemical-specific prevention steps include the availability of self contained-breathing apparatus (SCBA), awareness of the hazardous and toxic properties of chlorine, and presence of chlorine detectors. 

F). The Water Plant has updated some of its safety equipment and has reviewed all its programs related to safety.  

G.) The Water Plant had no accidents within the last 5 years.
